title: Indigenous
common: List of families with at least one indigenous person known as an ancestor, some of them were treated as Europeans for their own descendants, that tried to avoid miscegenation (Schneider, Alberto L., 2016, pp. 99-100) and create a social status.

value.name: Indigenous of Piratininga
value.desc: are people that lived in São Paulo - SP in the first years of the city, these people have Tibiriçá as their ancestor.

value.name: Indigenous of Ururay
value.desc: are people that lived near to Ururay and that would be/are descendants of Piqueroby.

value.name: Bettinck/Betting/Betim
value.desc: family begins to have Indigenous ancestors when Gehard Bettinck has a marriage with Custódia Dias.

value.name: Dias (São Vicente)
value.desc: family begins to have Indigenous ancestors when Lopo Dias has a marriage with Beatriz Dias.

value.name: Dias (Bahia)
value.desc: is an indigenous person reported by Pedro Taques (de Moura, Américo, 1951, pp. 347) and Silva Leme (Silva Leme, Luiz G., 1904, Volume VII, pp. 03) as a Portuguese, but Priest Serafim Leite shows this is not possible (Projeto Compartilhar, "Pedro Dias").

value.name: Dias (Espírito Santo - Fundão)
value.desc: are indigenous people that appear in "devassa" of Jesuits in the 18th Century.

value.name: Fernandes
value.desc: family begins to have Indigenous ancestors when Manuel Fernandes Ramos has a marriage with Suzana Dias.

value.name: Leme
value.desc: family begins to have Indigenous ancestors when Fernão Dias (Paes) has a marriage with Maria Leite da Silva.

value.name: Rodrigues (São Vicente/São Paulo)
value.desc: after centuries being treated as a family with origin in Porto - PT, it is necessary to modify this understanding, because preliminary research using genetic sequencing is showing them as Indigenous.
